title: Linux unalias Command with Practical Examples
description: Learn how to use the unalias command in Linux to temporarily disable aliases and manage them effectively in the terminal.

meta.title: Linux unalias Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Learn how to use the unalias command in Linux to temporarily disable aliases and manage them effectively in the terminal.
meta.keywords: Linux, unalias, command, alias, terminal, system configuration, settings

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of the unalias Command

verify.name: Verify the unalias command
verify.hint: Ensure that you have created the alias for the 'ls' command and then executed the 'ls' command after disabling the alias.

steps.title: Create and Manage Aliases in the Terminal

verify.name: Verify the git status alias
verify.hint: Ensure that you have created the alias for the 'git status' command and then executed the 'gs' alias.

verify.name: Verify the git commit alias
verify.hint: Ensure that you have created the alias for the 'git commit -m' command and then executed the 'gcm' alias.

steps.title: Temporarily Disable Aliases Using the unalias Command

verify.name: Verify the unalias command
verify.hint: Ensure that you have created the alias for the 'll' command, disabled the alias using the 'unalias' command, and then executed the 'll' command.

verify.name: Verify the unalias of multiple aliases
verify.hint: Ensure that you have created the aliases for the 'll' and 'rm' commands, disabled the aliases using the 'unalias' command, and then executed the 'll' and 'rm' commands.
